review:
Overwatch 2 is an outer shell of what it was.

A little backstory: I've picked this game up for PC in 2017 (I think? time has quite quickly gone by), hell I still I have my physical box with the disc included for the original game. Overwatch was one of my most played games at that time, it was addicting, fun and overall pleasant to play. The old heroes, the live service taking the backseat and the overall fun of booting up the game, getting a friend or family to play with you, and the excitement when they revealed the "new" story missions, I'm taking about the Uprising, Retribution and Storm Rising. Now? Now that spark is gone, Blizzard just lost it. 

I've created a second account, to play some new games, outside of my typically played genres. Why? I was bored, and decided to give it a try. I saw that Overwatch 2 was coming to Steam, and thought to myself "Damn, I haven't played this game since Season 2, maybe they changed something, maybe its worth playing again? After they cancelled the promised PvE mode (the one that was announced back in 2019, the one that costed 60$ and promised us a skill tree, full campaign and pretty good replayability), maybe they had some more time, and decided to fix certain problems". So I waited for the August 10 release date, pre-loaded the game, and opened it. And what I was met with, was pure disappoitment. 

Starting off, I'm not even going to talk about the fact that they made the game free-to-play and gave us battle passes instead of lootboxes, as thats a topic for another day. The premium currency is also not going to be covered in this review. I'm going to jump from topic to topic, so I apologise for that, but I'm not the best at writing reviews. You boot up the game, you get greeted by a cinematic and get shipped off to the firing range. The same tutorial that is in Overwatch 1 is here, do the tutorial, yada yada, and you get onto the main menu. You might see, that almost all modes are locked, and you have only one "sub-mode" to play. Why? Because Blizzard thinks that You might get overwhelmed by these modes at the start as a new player. That's just not true. The same thing happened with heroes, which in my opinion is not a good decision but also not a bad one. The game has now 38 heroes, and the new player can get a bit overwhelmed by all the abilities, decisions and team comp. The problem here is the fact that Overwatch, as a base was made with the idea of picks and counter-picks and locking the heroes behind playing 30 matches (match typically lasts from 10-15 minutes, times 30, results from 5 hours to 7.5 hours to unlock every hero). 

The not-so-live service. Blizzard in all their wisdom, shall we say, butchered the game. The game has changed from 6v6 to 5v5, which eliminated the 2 dmg, 2 tanks. 2 healers meta. I won't get into it, your opinion is yours, feel free to share it. Speaking of heroes and team composition, blizz has decided to put heroes into the battle pass. If you want to play the hero, You have to level up the battle pass OR hand it over. That dark thing, Your 10$ bill. And it's not nitpicking as the heroes aren't at some low tier. No, they're at tier 45 in an 80 tier battle pass (I'm not counting the tier 100 to 200, as they don't give you anything except from a little nametag). If You want to play them, too bad, either buy the battle pass (which gives You INSTANT access to the hero) or wait till the season is over and complete the hero challenge. Old cosmetics for heroes, such as lets say the Christmas event ones or the Summer Games ones, are only obtainable by buying them with their premium currency, which results in a single skin costing around 15$. As far as I'm aware, You CAN'T buy them with the old currency, the so called "legacy" points. The game itself is now a pay-to-win model.

The promised PvE: A distant dream. As I earlier stated, the studio, still under the lead of Jeff Kaplan, a man which was the lead designer and game director, was overall a pretty good game. Sure, there were some bad decisions made here and there, but every game had that. In 2019 we got the "Zero Hour" cinematic, showing off the Null Sector, an enemy which we fought in these free event missions (mentioned above), specifically in Uprising. They were show off again, with a new coat of paint, a redesigned look and new, fierce enemies. We got a look at the Titan, a giant, doomsday robot which was capable of destroing a city, or more. We got a look at redesigned looks of our beloved heroes and of course, an amazing cinematic. This cinematic was the reveal trailer for Overwatch 2 and it prompted us to look at the site. The site, and I quote said this: "THE STORY CONTINUES WITH PVE
Beginning in 2023, experience the next chapter of the Overwatch saga with a series of intense PvE missions set during the second Crisis. Rally Overwatch agents and confront the deadly forces of Null Sector all over the world." While not saying a lot, there was a seperate page, which described it a lot more, but unfortunately as far as I know it was lost to time. At that same time, at Blizzcon 2019, the event hosted by Blizzard, they showed us abilities, overview of the game and AN ENTIRE MISSION. It looked amazing, and even the small talent tree, which allowed you to change certain features of heroes, such as Tracer's Pulse Bomb (her ultimate) now causes a chain reaction, but instead your pistols aren't automatically reloaded when using abiliies. Now, in 2023 the game has received the first part of missions. 3 missions for 15$, and one of them is the original, 2019 mission. This is just a joke. They cancelled the original vision of the mode, made it live service, without the service and that's all. Now, after you complete the missions, which take about and 1h 30 minutes, COMBINED, you have to wait again, a year or so probably and pay AGAIN to get access to new missions. And when did they annouce this? On a dev chat, when they said that most of the features are scrapped and the missions are now live service.

It's not a game update, it's not a sequel. It's a fucking shop overhaul patch. I'l be honest, I'll still play this game, simply for the nostalgia that I have from 2017, but ultimately if You want to play, or not. The decision is Yours. I'm probably gonna make a video review of it, maybe not. If I will I'll link it down below. This is not a promotion of my channel, simply an addon.

one of the worst games ever made. overwatch 1 was better than this garbage

Hear me out, this game is not by any means perfect, same with many other games. I have played this game since 2016 and I have seen it all when it comes to this game. This game is extremely fun to play especially with friends and I have a lot of memories tied to this game. If you can look past the toxicity and just have a fun time with your friends or even by yourself you can 100% enjoy this game. Now get to gamin <3
